intro: Odontadenia semidigyna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands. Odontadenia semidigyna plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
